Would I what? Would you like me 
 to be your companion?

1516.40.text: I think it's great, I do!

1530.68.text:
Have you got...? 
 No, I cannot have any.

1543.68.text: Do you want to dance with me?

1554.52.text:
MUSIC: Greased Lighting 
 by John Travolta

1569.04.text:
Bill's taking to her, 
 so I think there's potential.

1571.68.text:
If we could get them to talk 
 properly with us,

1574.00.text:
then it could be 
 a great companion for people,

1590.56.text:
So maybe we can't fully connect with
 robots in the way that they are,

1594.88.text:
but the magic behind robots is 
 the humans, the humans are there,

1599.64.text:
they're doing the hard work, 
 they're putting in the time

1602.00.text:
because they care and they have 
 empathy for one another

1607.40.text: how we get to live as human beings.

1613.40.text:
Along the way, I've seen how 
 technology can help improve

1616.84.text:
our lives, both physically 
 and emotionally.

1621.08.text:
After three sessions, 
 Rochelle has got back on the tube

1623.80.text:
and has started 
 to regain her freedom.

1627.24.text:
Bill's finally got himself 
 a smartphone,

1629.28.text:
helping him to connect 
 with his family.

1637.48.text:
Hope you don't mind 
 my driving, Samantha.

1639.52.text:
A lot of my dates complain 
 that I'm too aggressive.

1651.16.text:
HE IMITATES SPANISH ACCENT 
 Hello, Samantha? Samantha!

1654.76.text:
HE GASPS 
 It works! It works in Spanish!

1662.52.text:
All that is necessary for 
 the triumph of evil

1665.24.text: is that good men do nothing.
